poem:
Title: From "Kingdom of Dust"

Sunrise seeds the desert's dark, 
in Khan Younis, echoes stark,
Hospitals isolated, hearts aghast,
The shadow of occupation deeply cast.

Gunsmoke tales of battles fierce,
world whispers, troubled tears pierce.
Under sniper's stare, tank's thunder, aerial ire,
Fruitless trees fertilized with the seeds of fire.

Who cultivates peace in this splintered ground,
where the echoes of humanity scarcely sound?
